hmmm... apparently this happens if you enter a bad url in the launch (404)

Hello.

I have the same XPCOM error -2147467262. Actually, Eclipse does not start because of that. That happened just after installation of eclipse-bin in Source Mage GNU/Linux. I will report also to Source Mage bugzilla since it can be something distro-specific. What other information should I provide for more efficient investigation of this case?

I've fount a discussion of the same bug at mandriva site: http://qa.mandriva.com/show_bug.cgi?id=21612
And unset'ting MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME, as suggested there, really makes Eclipse start well.

I get this error on a new Eclipse 3.2 install with internal browser selected as the browser on Ubuntu Breezy Linux after launching a Help window from Help->Help Contents and selecting any help category in the left navigation panel of the Help window. It happens every time. If I select the external browser option everything works fine in the browser.
Problem viewing help fixed by adding export of MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME to environment before launching eclipse.

(In reply to comment #0)
> org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: XPCOM error -2147467262

This is the NS_NOINTERFACE error, thrown in this case by PromptService.getBrowser().

> it was my second debug session

We don't allow multiple JS debug sessions any more, so this should no longer be an issue.  Closing as WORKSFORME.
